meanings.definition: wizzes (noun): plural form of wiz, meaning a person who is very skilled or knowledgeable in a particular area
meanings.sent1: The wizzes in the math club always solve problems quickly.
meanings.sent2: She is one of the wizzes in the science lab.
meanings.sent3: The wizzes at the coding competition were like human calculators.
meanings.sent4: His ability to fix any computer issue made him a wiz among wizzes.
meanings.sent5: The wizzes in the chess tournament strategized their moves carefully.

meanings.definition: wizzes (verb): third person singular form of wiz, meaning to move quickly or skillfully
meanings.sent1: He wizzes through the obstacle course with ease.
meanings.sent2: The ball wizzes past the goalie into the net.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel wizzes up the tree in a flash.
meanings.sent4: Time wizzes by when you're having fun.
meanings.sent5: The car wizzes down the highway, leaving dust in its wake.

meanings.definition: wizzes (adjective): comparative form of wiz, meaning more skilled or knowledgeable than others
meanings.sent1: She is the wizzes student in the class.
meanings.sent2: The wizzes chef in the restaurant creates delicious dishes.
meanings.sent3: The wizzes team won the championship with ease.
meanings.sent4: His wizzes mind could solve any puzzle thrown his way.
meanings.sent5: The wizzes professor explained complex theories in a simple way.
